bow: coming to terms with one and done my son is months old super happy and joy to be around 90 of the time love him dearly but these last few months have been the hardest of my life always wanted to have two kids but can not imagine going through this again with the added craziness of toddler or pre schooler might explode think my husband would go bald but now really sad about it feel like grieving the loss of the family that always imagined have also would love for my son to have sibling to play with as he grows up but the thought of actually delivering anther baby had 59 hour labor with him going through the newborn phase again and dealing with all the sleepless nights makes me physically sick wish could just skip that and have toddler right out of the gate know do have to make the decision now or even for few years yet compulsive planner so those of you who are one and done how did you come to that decision did anyone think they were done after one and then change their mind one and done my son is 8yrs old came to that decision mostly because by the time we were financially stable and was able to be sahm he was already feel like waited too long to give my son sibiling he could grow up with ideally would of liked to have 2nd child closer to my first one my sister is 16 months younger than me and we are best friends always have been my other sister is 7yrs younger and we were never close growing up til she was an adult like parenting single child never overly stressed or worn out he has my undivided attention at all times he sitting next to me on our balcony playing minecraft and we are listening to the beatles so peaceful also with one child still have life outside of being mother get to travel with my husband often and by myself often when you have child feel like it easier to find child care help from family do want little girl but that ca be guaranteed so happy with my family of in my quiet peaceful clean house gt wish could just skip that and have toddler right out of the gate there are many young children looking for loving home just thought too keep in mind for the future also with one child feel like we can provide for him better financially his college is already paid for we will be able to help him buy car when he older must have good grades job birthdays and christmas are stressful clothes and shoes do leave me broke he has lot because he an only child but ve always made sure to never spoil him oh absolutely it something that ve been thinking of even before we had the baby ve always been interested in adopting that actually sounds really wonderful thank you for the perspective there nothing wrong with waiting few years to decide though my friend toddler can be nightmare she loves taking care of the newborn baby sister and they love having two kids even though the first was really difficult see how things go with this one maybe you ll get baby hungry and you ll both decide you re ready for another as an only child it lonely my mom was going to have another child and miscarried and was really broken hearted about it really wanted little sister once you get to toddler hood you will miss baby hood my son is months old in my late pregnancy started to feel like would be one and done mom too and after my scary section only felt more strongly that he would be my only child but now not so sure it only been months and miss being pregnant and his newborn baby ness it something would love to experience again one day but on the other hand really like the freedom and flexibility one child offers like being able to give him all of my attention and all of our family resources my husband and both have siblings so am hoping some cousins come along soon so he will have playmates to grow up with like you unsure but like to have plan want to know what the future holds so ve been thinking about it lots yeah people keep telling me that but the more he grows up the *cooler* he gets his milestones are amazing and seeing how his brain changes and gets better at figuring out his world astounds me ca wait to see what he does next do miss the newborn stage at all just enjoy it cause eventually he will telling you off in baby language think we will be one and done family my son is 19 months old and feel like he is just enough for us do go back and forth on what want because seeing him interact with other kids definitely makes me wonder what kind of big brother he would be but then you have the days when you ca even deal with one let alone imagine dealing with two or more plus think about all the fun stuff we can do just the three of us the most trouble have had is actually other people from telling us he will be lonely to saying we will deprive him of chance of great relationship with his sibling like just because you re family you will get along yeah ok you have time to decide maybe you will want another in years maybe never but think as long as you guys are happy with one for now enjoy haha cant wait seriously pretty sure no one makes the decision to have another at months they are way too in the thick of it at that point give it few months and your memory may start playing tricks on you there nothing really wrong with having one child you can make that great too for now just focus on getting your sanity back it will happen swear we always only wanted one child everything from pregnancy birth and raising my daughter for the last 10 months has been pretty ideal but still so hard really ca imagine putting in this much work to have another one and would feel bad if did care for second child in the same way ap ebfing co sleeping babywearing so we are one and done if an accident happens of course we ll step up but we are planning on having anymore feel like our family was perfectly complete with my daughter have always thought that if ever do feel the need for more in the future then becoming foster parent would be good alternative do love teaching and guidance just do not want to go through the baby stage again you might check with your doctor about ppd felt similarly with my first and after long talk with my midwife she said that probably had ppd felt tons better after being on meds we had our second 18 months after the first and things were good if your kiddo is only months old think you should really give it more time before you decide one way or the other feel awful for saying this but did enjoy the newborn stage at all really thought would because ve loved holding friends newborns but when it was actually my kid well it was kind of boring but my son going to be year old soon and his personality cracks me up it so much fun watching him interact with the world and figure new things out every day it been rough year this kid could make the energizer bunny look like slacker but still think want at least another kid because of my experiences as an only grew up an only and there lots of great things about it we took vacations got tons of attention got spontaneous presents whenever my parents felt like it basically was very spoiled however do remember being lonely and wishing had brother or sister like most of my friends did living in dorm with so took some getting used to as an adult as never had that experience before the biggest factor both of my parents had passed on by the time was in my early 20s watching my husband interact with his brother and sister wish had someone like that who could reminisce with about my parents my situation is thankfully very unusual but just another datapoint for you to consider so many people talk about the high points of an only childhood but do go into what it like as an adult we have twins we wanted two but it they had been one we have stopped at one for the longest time after my daughter was born was convinced was done after about year changed my mind then got really sick and am not in the position to have another baby for long time really sad about it never wanted my daughter to be an only child wanted three my husband however is convinced we are done so we are my point is it ok to not want them now you may or may not change your mind later siblings do have to be close in age to appreciate each other not upset about this it more like confusion can confidently say that do have ppd may have when he was just born but pretty happy now sleepy as heck but good feel you on the traumatic birth experience and exhausting babyhood husband and are not baby people our son is much more interesting the older he gets but as they get older you start to see how fleeting babyhood is we gritted our teeth and bit the bullet for second pregnancy sucked and its chaos right now but its only about years of flat out mayhem for lifetime of the family we wanted now in the same position for third every fibre of my being abhors the idea of pregnancy and heading back into newborn territory once we re out of it this time but ask me again in 18 months 35 my daughter is months in few days by the time even want to think about trying for another be close to 40 do want to be 40 running after toddler there nothing wrong with that it just not something want in my life plus my so might reach into my body and yank my ovaries out if even thought about it lol was little sad about it too not because want another child but because was thinking about all the things she never experience like family trips with brother or sister and then thought about my own fucked up relationship with my two sisters and decided that was probably good thing thank you for posting this ve been trying to convince my husband to have second child sharing your story with him tipped the scales he said he had never considered adulthood as an only and said well guess we have to have two just give yourself time soon you will forget and when baby is about months and super perfectly adorable you will want another one just take things one day at time you do have to plan your whole life today out of curiosity did you have any other family close by growing up have an only and all the concerns you ve listed are ones ve considered but my daughter will be very close to her dad family including cousin who only year older than her have to wonder if it will alleviate some of that loneliness or if just trying to make myself feel better about choosing different experience for her gt siblings do have to be close in age to appreciate each other this is so true get along far better with my sister who is 10 years younger than me as opposed to the one that only years younger for me the ppd was about being sad just felt out of control felt like everything was going crazy around me and just kept getting mad but still think months is pretty young to make that kind of decision did really connect to my daughter till she was almost months old that when knew wanted second do decide now in few months it will be easier and the second baby is ton easier because you already halfway know what you are doing hang in there mama an alternative view in toddlerhood do miss baby hood on only child loneliness think that there the concern that only children are lonely children and think that when parents consider having second child as gift to their first that is probably the thing that they are most often concerned about which understand think that we have very visceral response to seeing child alone in sandbox but it was interesting speaking to psychologists about the experience of loneliness for only children lot of them believe that we have the strongest primary relationship with do this again it would be so easy the second time and do you think it would be wonderful if we could have it to do second time say this to anyone willing to adopt an older child do it so many want sad yeah he teased us by doing hour stretches for few nights then he stopped pretty dramatically deleted man hated that had such hard time with it good luck my husband and always said we wanted to kids now our first is weeks old and holy crap ca imagine doing this even one more time much less three had no idea it would be this hard trying not to think about it right now too overwhelming the adoption idea is great since as child gets older they become less adoptable so sad also keep in mind that at mo postpartum your hormones are still pretty wacky and you are likely sleep deprived focus on the now and worry about more kids later it can take up to year for your hormones to level out again and once you get some serious mommy ing under your belt you will have ton more confidence in your abilities by the time your son is the thought of newborn is so scary anymore an only child and as an adult wish had siblings to share my mother with she more of handful than my boys sometimes haha oh yeah my daughter did the same thing and then all the developmental stuff hits and you really miss those nights good luck on the next two months they were doozy for us yeah the past few nights have been an exercise in patience said screw it and let him fuss last night when he woke up at midnight and the little stinker put himself back to sleep until 4am did have to get out of bed from to it was glorious sure tonight will have me up every hour just to throw me off yay optimism we are one and done for some of the same reason others have mentioned we do want to stretch our time amp resources with second we feel lucky to have had healthy happy first child so far and do really want to test fate age is factor for us too had one sibling and my partner had none she was lonely sometimes without sibling was lonely sometimes *with* my sibling an older brother who resented me and competed with me from day one teased me relentlessly never stood up for me single time and never showed me any particular affection as adults we have cordial relationship but very little in common so am not going to undertake all the work and responsibility of raising second child just on the off chance that he or she would end up friends with my daughter would encourage you to discover what you most want to do in your heart of hearts and do make your decision based on fear basically no matter which way you go you ca know what the other choice would have brought and people will judge you either way for different reasons but that ca be helped started to desire second at about months postpartum it has happened yet and little man is year old some people actually do crave children pretty fast but it is probably unusual yup ve read this from so many parents when you re going through the initial adjustments and the whole first year is bunch of constantly changing adjustments funny enough we were never going to be parents until life changes made us reconsider and decide to have kid for nearly years we were 100 certain we were never having second until one moment watching our daughter we both thought to ourselves and later talked about it that we did want second so now we re on number two my point here is that months in do be so sure you re on one side of the fence or the other the thing parenthood has told me is to never say never that things could always occur that will change my decision saying that if you re not feeling it right now take concerted measures to not have another one because you re in what like to call the super prime fertile phase right now know so many people who experienced surprise pregnancy around months because they figured that it was really possible to get pregnant so soon after baby my nephews are irish twins because my brother and his wife figured that since they needed help getting pregnant the first time that would take as much effort apparently lot of women bodies just need little kickstart to understand what to do and once that happens the making is easy what is involved with adopting toddler the main reason for us we have an 18mo daughter is just feeling we are the family we were meant to be lot goes into it of course have younger sister and we lost our mom when was 12yo my husband is an only child and never knew his dad my husband never felt lonely or sad that he did have sibling we feel partly selfish because it part of it is that we would like to maintain our quality of life and we want it to include being able to afford more family vacations and maybe even letting her bring friend along pay for her college still be able to do the things we did before her and even now not that having more kids necessarily means we could have also felt like am more maternal than thought would be but it still feels like it requires more work and effort than others like being able to focus on my little girl and think staying in my new comfort zone will keep me better mother to her rather than spreading me thinner across more kids it really depends on where you are from and public vs private adoptions and open vs closed where am from all adoptions are open the bio family continues to have access to the child there are some basics though you will have to go though police check the placement and fit interviews and mountains of paper work some of my friends are in the process of adopting some toddler younger kids right now they registered with the agency government did the full record checks had their finances examined and went to numerous interviews after all of that they have access to the database of adoptable children and can indicate which kids they are interested in the guardians can see their profile and agree to meet with them then the fit interviews and home inspection etc then if everyone is happy they can move onto the legal transfers do know all the details but that is the process as know it sorry just saw your response have three older half siblings who all have kids so have two nieces who were year younger than me that spent lot of time with growing up went away for college though and then moved away for work afterwards and everyone else in the family stayed in the same location roughly within an hour drive of each other still talk with each of them at least monthly but it not the same kind of relationship my husband has with his siblings you know do want to like guilt you into having
